Description: Attic pottery lid, intact save for part of edge and knob; interior: reserved; exterior: around knob, degenerate tongue pattern; outside, interlacing lotus bud pattern; around edge of lid, black band.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 126, pl. XXXVIII, no. 352.5)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 231, no. 170)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2118)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5748 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
